summary: When servicemembers are unexpectedly absent from duty, their wellbeing may be at risk. Their families can suffer, and mission readiness may be reduced. DOD collects and reports data on the number of involuntary absences (e.g., involving accidents or foul play). But the full extent of voluntary absences (e.g., desertions) is unknown because some of the data DOD collects is incomplete or unreliable. Also, some military...
title: Servicemember Absences: DOD Actions Needed to Enhance Related Data, Procedures, and Staffing
